author: Reuters Editorial
title: U.S. says will press North Korea on human rights abuses
text:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States is gravely concerned about human rights abuses in North Korea and will press for accountability for those responsible, the U.S. State Department said on Wednesday ahead of an expected summit between and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un.
“We remain gravely concerned and deeply troubled by these abuses. In tandem with the maximum pressure campaign, we will continue to press for accountability for those responsible,” the State Department said in a statement.
Reporting by Eric Beech; Editing by Eric Walsh
